'Terminus' is a monologue play by Mark O'Rowe. Written entirely in rhyme, the
play follows three characters (a former schoolteacher, her lonely, estranged
daughter, and a serial killer who has sold his soul to the Devil) over the
course of a single night in Dublin.

Terminus premiered at the Abbey Theatre in Dublin on June 9, 2007, before
touring internationally.
